question_text: Why do SSDs typically have lower latency compared to mechanical drives?
answer_options: They use a dedicated cooling fan
They utilize moving heads and platters
They contain memory modules with no physical movement
They require BIOS-level reinitialization at boot
correct_answer: They contain memory modules with no physical movement
explanation: SSDs have no moving parts and use solid-state memory, allowing for near-instantaneous access to data.
